channel.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us
channel.description: Get the latest news online at Major Digest, the top online news resource for the most reliable news sources. Stay informed about the world around you!

image.title: Major Digest - Reliable and Comprehensive News Sources: us

item.title: University of Pennsylvania investigating vulgar emails sent from school account blasting 'woke' institution
item.description: University of Pennsylvania hit by fake email attack with vulgar messages sent to campus community. School confirms its security team is investigating.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: New multistate lottery game expected in 2026 could make you a millionaire
item.description: Sure, winning a record-breaking Powerball jackpot may be cool, but what about $1 million a year for the rest of your life?
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KREX 5

item.title: Ukraine says it hit a key fuel pipeline near Moscow that supplies Russian forces
item.description: KYIV, Ukraine (AP) — Ukrainian forces hit an important fuel pipeline in the Moscow region that supplies the Russian army, Ukraine's military intelligence said Saturday, a claim that came amid a sustained Russian campaign of massive drone and missile attacks on Ukraine’s energy infrastructure.
item.dc:creator: SAMYA KULLAB, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Israel says the latest remains returned from Gaza are not bodies of hostages
item.description: JERUSALEM (AP) — The remains of three people Hamas handed over to the Red Cross in Gaza do not belong to any hostages, Israel said Saturday, in the latest setback to the U.S.-brokered ceasefire in the Israel-Hamas war.
item.dc:creator: RENATA BRITO, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Daylight saving time: These states want to stop changing the clocks
item.description: Nearly every state has considered legislation that would lock the clocks — here's where those efforts stand.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, KGET 17, NBC

item.title: Furloughed federal workers face delays getting unemployment pay during shutdown
item.description: Thousands of furloughed federal workers are trying to navigate the unemployment system, in a sharp increase that is still a fraction of the 670,000 furloughed during the shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Jonathan Mattise, Associated Press, KPRC 2

item.title: With bombs and bravado, Trump puts his own stamp on Reagan's 'peace through strength' mantle
item.description: WEST PALM BEACH, Fla. (AP) — It wasn’t so long ago that President Donald Trump spoke of building a legacy as a “peacemaker.
item.dc:creator: AAMER MADHANI, BEN FINLEY, and MATTHEW LEE, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: Tanzanian President Hassan wins disputed election with more than 97% of vote, official results show
item.description: KAMPALA, Uganda (AP) — Tanzanian President Samia Suluhu Hassan won the country’s disputed election with more than 97% of the vote, according to official results announced early Saturday. Her two main opponents had both been prevented from running, leaving her virtually unopposed.
item.dc:creator: RODNEY MUHUMUZA, Associated Press, PHL 17

item.title: How does 'doomscrolling' actually affect us? Experts weigh in
item.description: While it may feel relaxing to put one's mind on pause and endless scroll the feed of a favorite app, experts are urging people to beware of certain warning signs.
item.dc:creator: Jeremy Tanner, WFLA, NBC

item.title: FBI raid at Idaho horse track shows how immigration is a top focus across law enforcement
item.description: BOISE, Idaho (AP) — The first sign something was amiss was the thwack of helicopter rotors overhead, followed by screams.
item.dc:creator: REBECCA BOONE, Associated Press, KREX 5

item.title: New-look Dodgers lineup only produces 4 hits but they come at right time as LA forces Game 7
item.description: TORONTO (AP) — A new-look lineup for the Los Angeles Dodgers only produced four hits in Game 6, but three of them came in a three-run rally off Blue Jays starter Kevin Gausman.
item.dc:creator: IAN HARRISON, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: FDA restricts use of kids' fluoride supplements citing emerging health risks
item.description: The Food and Drug Administration on Friday moved to limit the use of fluoride supplements used to strengthen children's teeth, the latest action by Health Secretary Robert F. Kennedy Jr. and his deputies against a chemical that is a mainstay of dental care.
item.dc:creator: MATTHEW PERRONE, Associated Press, Fox 5

item.title: ICE officer shoots illegal immigrant during Phoenix traffic stop gone wrong, both hospitalized
item.description: ICE officer and Honduran man injured in Phoenix shooting during traffic stop. Jose Garcia-Sorto hospitalized in stable condition after Interstate 17 incident.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: When will SNAP EBT cards be reloaded? Delays still possible despite judges' rulings
item.description: Just hours before the looming deadline, two judges ruled Friday that the federal government must continue funding SNAP during the government shut down. However, those expecting food assistance on Nov. 1 may still see delays.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KRON4

item.title: Florida residents fall victim to new crypto scam, $1.1M lost
item.description: Officials said these victims met the scammer on social media, and the scammer initiated a conversation.
item.dc:creator: Summer Poole, NewsNation

item.title: Ohio panel and Virginia lawmakers move forward with congressional redistricting plans
item.description: An Ohio panel adopted new U.S. House districts on Friday that could boost the GOP’s chances of winning two additional seats in next year’s elections and aid President Donald Trump’s efforts to hold on to a slim congressional majority.
item.dc:creator: DAVID A. LIEB, OLIVIA DIAZ and MARK SCOLFORO, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: South Carolina man chooses execution by firing squad despite concerns over last death by bullets
item.description: COLUMBIA, S.C. (AP) — A man on death row in South Carolina who taunted investigators with messages written with a victim's blood chose Friday to die by firing squad. Stephen Bryant, 44, will be the third man this year to die by South Carolina's newest execution method. His execution is set for Nov.
item.dc:creator: JEFFREY COLLINS, Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: Virginia Senate approves Democrat-led redistricting amendment
item.description: The party has to pass the amendment in the state legislature one more time before it can be teed up before the public for a vote.
item.dc:creator: Caroline Vakil, NewsNation

item.title: Wisconsin judge puts on hold ruling that required citizenship check of voters
item.description: MADISON, Wis. (AP) — A Wisconsin judge on Friday put on hold his order that requires elections officials to verify the citizenship of all 3.6 million registered voters in the battleground state before the next statewide election in February.
item.dc:creator: SCOTT BAUER, Associated Press, KLAS, CBS News

item.title: Top blue city university's newspaper tracks ICE operations amid frequent violent clashes with feds
item.description: University of Chicago student newspaper launches interactive ICE tracking map, soliciting community tips on federal immigration enforcement activities in local neighborhoods.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: 70 years after the first sabotage of a US airliner, the 44 killed are finally being honored
item.description: LONGMONT, Colo. (AP) — The windows shook as dynamite aboard an airplane exploded over Conrad Hopp's family farm in northern Colorado 70 years ago.
item.dc:creator: COLLEEN SLEVIN, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: The Latest: Trump administration must fund SNAP payments during the shutdown, judges rule
item.description: Federal judges have ruled that the Trump administration must continue funding SNAP during the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Associated Press, Local 4

item.title: FDA says drugmakers have recalled a blood pressure medicine tainted with a cancer-causing chemical
item.description: The U.S. Food and Drug Administration says drugmakers have recalled more than a half-million bottles of the blood pressure medication prazosin hydrochloride over concerns it may include a cancer-causing chemical.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WGN 9

item.title: Photos: Trumps host Halloween event at White House
item.description: President Donald Trump and first lady Melania Trump hosted trick-or-treaters on Thursday in a Halloween celebration that has become a fun White House tradition.
item.dc:creator: The Hill, WGN 9

item.title: Cannabis use may boost tobacco addiction risk in young Americans, study finds
item.description: New research from UC San Diego found that cannabis use among youth may be responsible for 13% of new cases of regular tobacco use in the US, suggesting that cannabis use should be considered a major risk factor for later tobacco addiction.
item.dc:creator: Amber Coakley, KRON4

item.title: Deadly wake-up call: Alleged frat hazing electrocution highlights student dangers in off-campus homes
item.description: Rutgers student critically injured in alleged fraternity hazing electrocution incident raises serious questions about off-campus Greek life safety oversight.
item.dc:creator: Fox News

item.title: DC Mayor Bowser says residents will receive SNAP, WIC benefits in November
item.description: Washington, D.C., Mayor Muriel Bowser (D) on Thursday said the city will fund the Supplemental Nutrition Assistance Program (SNAP) and the separate program for Women, Infants, and Children (WIC) for the month of November amid the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: Ashleigh Fields, KRON4

item.title: NASA takes one step closer to launching quiet supersonic jets
item.description: A supersonic jet plane designed to make very little noise took flight for the first time this week, cruising over the southern California desert just after sunrise in what could be the first step toward much faster commercial travel, according to NASA. NASA and the U.S.
item.dc:creator: SAFIYAH RIDDLE, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Nationals finalizing hire of 33-year-old Blake Butera as manager, AP source says
item.description: The Washington Nationals are finalizing a deal to hire 33-year-old Blake Butera as manager, according to a person with knowledge of the situation. The person spoke to The Associated Press on Thursday on condition of anonymity because nothing had been announced.
item.dc:creator: NOAH TRISTER, Associated Press, KTLA 5

item.title: Judge considers demand to force government to keep funding SNAP food aid despite shutdown
item.description: A federal judge in Boston on Thursday challenged the Trump administration's argument that SNAP benefits could be suspended for the first time in the food aid program's history because of the government shutdown.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, WFLA, NBC

item.title: SNAP scams incoming, expert warns. Here's what to watch out for
item.description: The fast-approaching SNAP benefit freeze could leave millions of Americans vulnerable to scammers, officials and experts are warning.
item.dc:creator: Alix Martichoux, KRON4

item.title: Patients go without needed treatment after the government shutdown disrupts a telehealth program
item.description: MINOOKA, Ill. (AP) — Bill Swick has a rare degenerative brain disease that inhibits his mobility and speech. Instead of the hassle of traveling an hour to a clinic in downtown Chicago to visit a speech therapist, he has benefited from virtual appointments from the comfort of his home.
item.dc:creator: ALI SWENSON and OBED LAMY, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Why you won't receive a Supplemental Security check on Nov. 1
item.description: October is nearly over, which means you may be checking your calendar to see when you'll receive your November Social Security benefits.
item.dc:creator: Addy Bink, Fox 5

item.title: 5 more arrested as Louvre jewel heist investigation continues
item.description: The dragnet tightened around the Louvre thieves on Thursday. Five more people were seized in the crown-jewels heist — including a suspect tied by DNA — the Paris prosecutor said, widening the sweep across the capital and its suburbs.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, KRON4

item.title: San Diego among the 'rattiest' cities in the US, according to annual rankings
item.description: For the first time in a decade, a new city has been named the 'rattiest' city in the country in Orkin's annual report of the most rodent-infested cities.
item.dc:creator: Spencer Kristensen, Fox 5

item.title: Erika Kirk's words spotlight forgiveness in a divided nation
item.description: “That man, that young man — I forgive him.” Erika Kirk softly spoke those words about the gunman accused of assassinating her husband, conservative activist Charlie Kirk, as she struggled to hold back tears last month during his memorial service. Her public declaration inspired another.
item.dc:creator: DEEPA BHARATH, Associated Press, ABC 4

item.title: Fan at Penguins game hospitalized after falling from upper concourse
item.description: A fan at Monday night's game between the Pittsburgh Penguins and St. Louis Blues was taken to a hospital after falling from the upper concourse at PPG Paints Arena.
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press, Fox 5
